pages.content: Hello Daniela, I wish you the best of luck as you work through the hints. After each hint, you will need to enter a password in order to progress to the next one. The hints will gradually become more challenging, so take your time with each step. I’m curious to see how far you’ll get and what you’ll think by the end. Until then, I’ll leave you to the journey—good luck, and I’ll be glad to hear about your progress later.

pages.title: The Quiet Bloom
pages.content:
There’s a softness that finds me whenever she drifts near—
a warmth that rises without warning,
as though the air itself shifts
to remind me what joy is supposed to feel like.

My practiced calm unravels in her presence,
and something unguarded stirs—
not loud,
not dramatic,
just honest in a way I rarely let myself be.

It surprises me
how natural it feels,
how effortlessly she coaxes light
from places I thought had long gone dim.

And when she turns away,
the quiet she leaves behind
feels like missing something
I never truly had.

pages.title: Where Small Joys Echo
pages.content:
Her voice brightens
when she speaks of small joys—
the kind that make the world feel warmer
just by being mentioned.

I find myself leaning in,
memorizing the shape of her happiness,
the way she glows
over something simple,
something cherished.

There’s tenderness in how she loves,
not loud or boastful,
but steady—
the sort of affection
that softens even the hardest days.

And in listening,
I learn more than she knows—
how gentle her heart is,
and how easily it teaches mine
to beat a little differently.

pages.title: A Warm-Hued Morning
pages.content:
Light seems to follow her—
catching in the strands that fall across her shoulders,
turning them golden at the edges,
as though the sun pauses
just to admire her.

Her gaze holds a quiet depth,
warm and earthy,
like something the daylight rises just to touch.

In those moments,
everything else blurs—
the world softens,
time loosens its grip,
and all that remains
is the quiet way she turns toward the light,
and the even quieter ache
that settles in me whenever she does.

pages.title: The Softness in the Cracks
pages.content:
She speaks of her uncertainties
as if they’re storms she must apologize for—
small tempests she fears
might send others running.

But all they do
is draw me nearer.

There’s something delicate
in the way she reveals her doubts,
something that leaves a trace
long after her words fade.

She worries me—
not in the way fear does,
but the way beauty does:
a fragile, aching pull
that makes the heart hope
it won’t break what it cherishes.

Every flaw she fears
only deepens the quiet longing
she never meant to inspire.

pages.title: Purple Fortunes
pages.content:
She carries both strength
and sweetness—
a rare blend of bold spirit
and gentle wonder.

There’s a fierce grace in her,
something steady and sure,
as if she was shaped
by a color deep enough
to stand its ground.

And then there’s the softness—
small, bright flecks of hope
that seem to follow her,
bits of luck she never notices
but always leaves behind.

With her, the world feels
a shade more vibrant,
a touch more charmed—
as though fate itself pauses
to watch her walk by,
dropping little blessings
in her path
and maybe,
if I’m lucky,
in mine too.

pages.title: The end
pages.content:
If you’ve made it to this point, I’m fairly certain you already have an idea of who I like. There was never really a need to play Sherlock Holmes when the entire situation could have been solved with one simple question: “Angel, am I your crush?” I wouldn’t have given a direct answer, of course—but I would have left enough hints to gently lead you there. I’ve never been very good at saying things outright, but I tend to let my actions and small moments speak instead.

The truth is, I’ve carried a quiet feeling around you for a long time, one that never really disappeared. I don’t know exactly what changed this year—only that something did. Being around you started to feel different in a way I hadn’t experienced before. With you, I felt safe. Safe enough to open up, to share things I don’t usually talk about, and to let my guard down without feeling judged. I found myself doing things I normally wouldn’t, not because I felt pressured, but because being around you made it feel natural.

I know how you feel about crushes, and I know how easily you get embarrassed. I’ve noticed how, whenever I compliment how you look, you immediately try to brush it off—usually with “No, don’t say that,” or sometimes just a quiet “no.” You never let those moments linger, as if you’re hoping the attention passes quickly. But even knowing that, I still want to be honest. Not because I expect anything in return, and not to make you uncomfortable, but because honesty feels important when it comes to something this real.

And the truth is, I didn’t fall for you because of how you look—though you are lovely, even if you don’t like hearing it. What I fell for was something deeper and quieter. I fell for the girl who doesn’t give up, even when things feel overwhelming. The girl who worries about the smallest details, who cares deeply about her friends, and who carries so much thoughtfulness without always realizing it. You have a way of showing your weakest side while still being strong, and that kind of strength is rare. I don’t think I’ve ever met someone quite like that before.
